body_html:
As a side note, there is a very fast moving effort for more community builds that I believe will offer more bleeding edge support. I understand CUDA 9.2 looks like the standard to you, but if you look at CUDA 9.0 it had at least 4 patches. It is actually the more stable version as people slowly flush out issues with CUDA 9.2. CUDA 9.2 was actually delayed due to some last minute bugs. CUDA 9.0 plus patches have had almost a year to slowly develop and become stable.

This does not mean we cannot try to move Windows to CUDA 9.2 if that would greatly benefit the community.
